content:
I notice both furnaces have run out of ingredients (iron ore) to smelt, but still have plenty of coal fuel (23 each). Let's add more iron ore to keep the production going:

```python
# Add more iron ore to both furnaces
furnace1 = get_entities()[0]
furnace2 = get_entities()[1]

# Add iron ore to first furnace
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace1.position, quantity=20)

# Add iron ore to second furnace
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace2.position, quantity=20)

# Let's verify our furnaces are working again
print("After adding more iron ore:")
print(get_entities())

# Check our current inventory
print("Current inventory:")
print(inspect_inventory())

# Wait briefly to allow some smelting to occur
sleep(5)

# Check status after waiting
print("Status after waiting:")
print(get_entities())
```

This should:
1. Replenish the iron ore in both furnaces
2. Allow them to continue smelting (they already have sufficient coal)
3. Show us the updated status of our production line

The furnaces are working efficiently (they still have plenty of coal), we just need to keep them supplied with iron ore to maintain production.
